sentences.sContent: He achieved notoriety as chief counsel to President Nixon in the Watergate break-in.
sentences.sCn: 在水门事件中，他作为尼克松总统的首席辩护律师被搞得声名狼藉。

remMethod.val: not(知道) + oriety(多) → 坏事人所共知 → 臭名昭著

words.tran: 声名狼藉的，臭名昭著的
众所周知地；声名狼藉地；恶名昭彰地

trans.tranCn: 声名狼藉， 臭名昭著
trans.tranOther: the state of being famous or well-known for something that is bad or that people do not approve of
